thread.title: Work should start soon on rails to trails path to USM
thread.title_full: Work should start soon on rails to trails path to USM - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi.com
title: Work should start soon on rails to trails path to USM
text:
HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) â€” Authorities say work will soon begin on a walking and biking path between downtown Hattiesburg and the University of Southern Mississippi . It's part of the Longleaf Trace rails-to-trails project.
The Hattiesburg American ( http://hatne.ws/1KyuIUn ) reports that city engineer Lamar Rutland told the City Council last week he expects to meet this week with the contractor. He says crews are expected on site in the next few weeks.
The spur will cover about two miles along a former railroad line.
Rutland says another tail spur will have to be rebid because all bids were too high. It would run from the Hattiesburg train depot to Chain Park.
The completed Trace would run about 43 miles from downtown Hattiesburg through USM, Sumrall and Bassfield to Prentiss.
___
Information from: The Hattiesburg American, http://www.hattiesburgamerican.com
